general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Werner
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Expressed concern for those affected by recent fires, emphasizing climate change is a serious threat, even to those outside high-risk areas. Urged residents to be prepared with a go-bag and clear brush around their homes.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Ex-officio Sanchez
general_commissioner_comments.comment: She and Ex-officio Ghazaryan have been meeting to advance their project ideas from the last meeting. She described plans for a block party featuring local market vendors, businesses, and high school organizations promoting sustainability. They are seeking input on merging this event with existing Earth Day Fair projects for better funding and exposure, as well as to explore potential funding sources.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Ex-officio Ghazaryan
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Shared that they planned a cultural food celebration event at the Adult Recreation Center in February, involving community members bringing in cultural and sustainable dishes, along with a clothing swap event for teens at the central library. She noted logistics and outreach details for these events.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Barchusf
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Suggested focusing on events with built-in audiences, such as the summer car show, by adding a sustainability corner, and marrying the cultural food tour with an existing event like the Repair Fair to reach a broader public.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Pinkerton
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Proposed that the prom clothing swap be held at the Earth Day event, or that it could be too late in the spring.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Werner
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Suggested inquiring whether the city's Unity Day is still active, offering another opportunity for collaboration.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Chairperson Bazemore
general_commissioner_comments.comment: These are great ideas and he hopes to see and attend some. He suggested Art Sock Plaza as a possible location for the cultural food event to boost current businesses.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Werner
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Encouraged consideration of organic waste reduction, embedded greenhouse gasses, cooking with scraps, and freezing food, proposing collaboration with restaurants to promote sustainable food practices.

agenda_items.title: Legislative Year Update
agenda_items.summary: Ms. Ross summarized relevant legislative updates, including an overview of the state budget, discussions around SB 1053 (plastic bags at grocery checkout) and SB 1221 (building decarbonization pilot program), and upcoming discussion of SB 1383 regarding organic waste. She also reported on activity around special legislative sessions and Prop 4 (SB 867) the Climate Bond. Areas being watched for the city are recycle water funding, extreme heat, and water allocation.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Chairperson Bazemore
commissioner_comments.comment: Thanked Ms. Ross for coming and requested they do this annually.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Chairperson Bazemore
commissioner_comments.comment: Asked about a the city's position with regard to legislation, requesting that staff let the commission know when it exceeds the commission's perview.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Barchusf
commissioner_comments.comment: Inquired about the working relationship between the city, Cal Cities, and CMUA, given that sometimes the city remains silent on bills supported by CMUA, and what the determining factor is on what positions the city takes.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Werner
commissioner_comments.comment: Confirmed she watched that part of the city council meeting and requested in the future in-person meetings are included as the baseline for the bid, or that it would be in the change order.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Pinkerton
commissioner_comments.comment: She and others understood that the commission had no authority, but that the quote was that the commission began directing city staff and Rincon to do extra work and burn through the original contract funds.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Pinkerton
commissioner_comments.comment: Pointed out it was good to be reminded that we are not allowed to incur expenses on behalf of the city.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Pasha Kartunian
commissioner_comments.comment: Inquired if charging infrastructure is part of Ms. Ghazaryan purview and if so, asked her to ensure areas where people congregate have charging infrastructure. For instance, none of the Montrose parking lots have any chargers even though they are city owned and the infrastructure is right there.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Werner
commissioner_comments.comment: Inquired if a lot of people take advantage of the rebate program from public benefit charges.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Pinkerton
commissioner_comments.comment: Wondered if the City's existing Unity Day could be utilized for promoting public benefit funds.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Pinkerton
commissioner_comments.comment: Asked to get a report from marketing as to all the different advertising/outreach mechanisms used, including direct mail, social media, and door to door outreach. Asked how many of each type of outreach result in sign ups for re-bates or other programs.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Werner
commissioner_comments.comment: Asked what the participation rate is for the rebates for electric vehicle charging stations and multi-family housing, and for commercial areas. It seems pretty generous and I am wondering how it's had any traction or if people are taking advantage of it.

commissioner_comments.comment: Asked for an update on Unity Day

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Werner

commissioner_comments.comment: There's a good comment that we should try to take more sustainable foods and cooking with scraps.

commissioner_comments.comment: Inquired if Ms. Soloyan is going to be one of the conduits between the Sustainability Office and GWP

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Barchusf
commissioner_comments.comment: Inquired how from an equity perspective they are reaching out to low income and non-English speaking households that could benefit from all the amazing programs, such as by targeting census tracts.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Barchusf
commissioner_comments.comment: asked if we are going to advertise that opportunity, I don't know the details around the GWP program so could you do that if you don't mind?

agenda_items.title: Plastic Waste Reduction Regulations, Proposed Ordinance and Incentive Programs
agenda_items.summary: The Commission discussed language changes recommended to them. The first change was regarding disposable food ware. Legal staff reviewed the existing state legislation and determined that the city is statutorily prohibited from imposing different or more restrictive regulations on the use or distribution of plastic bags. A suggestion was made about decoupling food waste from restaurants but it will not be done. 3 motions will need to be reviewed.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Werner
commissioner_comments.comment: Strenuously objected to including the word recyclable in this, because that includes plastics and typically containers are supposed to be clean and dry before they go into the blue bin. She doesn't see people wiping out their plastic food containers before tossing them in the bins, but with compostable you can have food residue. She would not include the recyclable because the stuff is going to get put into the bins dirty and will not get processed.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Chairperson Bazemore
commissioner_comments.comment: Agreed with the concern that compostable is not always available.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Chairperson Bazemore
commissioner_comments.comment: Wanted to be sensitive that it has been expressed that it is going to take time for that. So they do a phase in date so that they would get in line and have something to be for, as some other issues may still have, be part to this program. We could have a more realistic discussion on it.

oral_communications.speaker: Shane Lee
oral_communications.comment: He likes housing but not parking and supports eliminating parking mandates, as well as car-free streets and night markets. He stated that dense mixed-use walkable communities are vital and supports projects reducing car dependency, noting a third of carbon emissions in America are from cars. He suggested limiting parking mandates to encourage people to live closer to jobs and amenities. He is available Tuesdays and shared contact information.
